member.name: COWAIT_FLAGS
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the function.

member.name: COWAIT_FLAGS.COWAIT_DEFAULT
member.summary: Dispatch calls needed for marshaling without dispatching arbitrary calls.

member.name: COWAIT_FLAGS.COWAIT_WAITALL
member.summary: If set, the call to will return S_OK only when all handles associated with the synchronization object have been signaled and an input event has been received, all at the same time. In this case, the behavior of CoWaitForMultipleHandles corresponds to the behavior of the function with the dwFlags parameter set to MWMO_WAITALL. If COWAIT_WAITALL is not set, the call to CoWaitForMultipleHandles will return S_OK as soon as any handle associated with the synchronization object has been signaled, regardless of whether an input event is received.

member.name: COWAIT_FLAGS.COWAIT_ALERTABLE
member.summary: If set, the call to will return S_OK if an asynchronous procedure call (APC) has been queued to the calling thread with a call to the function, even if no handle has been signaled.

member.name: COWAIT_FLAGS.COWAIT_INPUTAVAILABLE
member.summary: If set, the call to will return S_OK if input exists for the queue, even if the input has been seen (but not removed) using a call to another function, such as .

member.name: COWAIT_FLAGS.COWAIT_DISPATCH_CALLS
member.summary: Dispatch calls from in an ASTA. Default is no call dispatch. This value has no meaning in other apartment types and is ignored.

member.name: COWAIT_FLAGS.COWAIT_DISPATCH_WINDOW_MESSAGES
member.summary: Enables dispatch of window messages from in an ASTA or STA. Default in ASTA is no window messages dispatched, default in STA is only a small set of special-cased messages dispatched. The value has no meaning in MTA and is ignored.
